page.title: 07ABERDEEN AIRPORT - 1
page.content:
Aberdeen Airport is situated in Dyce. It was opened on the 28th July, 1934 and has grown in size and importance since then. It was taken over by the British Airport Authority in 1975.
The airport is now extremely busy - 1000 people pass through it each day.{Between 1983-84 a total of {1,761,983 passengers were handled and {there were 83,444 aircraft movements.
Flights go to Amsterdam, Bergen, Copenhagen, Paris, London, Manchester, Newcastle, Birmingham, Glasgow, Edinburgh and Inverness. There are many helicopter flights to North Sea oil rigs each day.
